column5: Hi Guys  A little introduction and trip report here.  My name is Jason, I've been an occasional lurker here for a long time, but I've been reading some reports on here from the Algoma area and thought I'd start posing some reports too. I live in Sault Ste. Marie and I enjoy fishing all over the Algoma district.  Yesterday I took the family up to Lake Superior Provincial Park for some ice fishing.  On the way up the thermometer was reading -25 so I wasn't sure how much fishing we would be able to do with the little one, but the forecast was for a warmer day, so we continued on.    Saw a bunch of other people fishing the various other brook trout lakes on the way up to our lake. We decided to fish one of the bigger Lake Trout lakes in the park with a short walk in. We arrived at the parking area about 9:30 and after a little exercise  we arrived. The lake had 12" of good ice, very little snow, but a couple inches of slush in some small areas by shore.    We caught a few fish, including these two which we brought home for dinner. I missed 4 good hits because I wasn't paying attention, I guess having a kid will do that too you. White tube jigs failed me today, Green and silver jigging spoons were the ticket.  My son Nolan on his first fishing trip.    This is the other one we brought home.    It started snowing soon after we got there and it warmed up to -6 on the ice and much warmer in the in the tent.    Left the lake about 3:30, this is my wife Beth with our son on the hike out.    On the way home we saw this wolf crossing the ice on Lake Superior. He was a little to far out from shore and it was a little too dark for a good picture.    So everyone had a great time and the trout were delicious.
Awesome! Nice fish! I too was in the park yesterday chasing lakers/brookies. Geez it was freezing in the am forsure....     TDunn
Solid introduction and report.  I think you've got the hang of this.
howdy!   great report.  awesome to see your family out as well.  it's my favourite place.
Awesome first report.  Getting your son started early..nice  Cheers  Craig
awesome first report, welcome aboard, nice to have your wife and child to be such troopers
Great stuff Smitter! Welcome aboard, thank you for the great report and yes, a really nice family you all are.
Thanks for taking the time to post, excellent report!
Great report and welcome to the board!
Thanks for the kind words guys.  If I'm lucky I'll have some more reports to share in the coming weeks.
Nice report. thankyou. my daughter was about that size on her first hunting trip. She spent many weekends in LSPP in her first year as well.
